page.title: 18Cropthorne Annual Walkabout
page.content: In 1975 it was thought that the natural beauty of our village with its private gardens reaching down to the Avon might well be used to advantage to help with the cost of maintaining and running the Church. Thus, our{ {"Walkabout"}was born. At first on a very modest scale - a few gardens open,refreshments,flowers in the church and locally made jam and cakes for sale. It was held during{the first {weekend in May}and suprisingly,many visitors came. Now the{Cropthorne Walkabout}has become well-known some{3500 visitors come annually to view the {gardens,}admire the{Church floral {displays}and to buy locally produced {craft items, cakes and preserves. A very rural scene,enhanced by{Maypole {dancing}by the schoolchildren,{Morris {Dancers}and a{Brass Band.
